Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# BlackRock, Inc. (BLK) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 14, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $975.37 (closing price on October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq; intraday as of 10/14/24 ~$976)  
**Market Capitalization:** $144.82B (as of October 11, 2024 close, per Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $788.50 - $1,073.17  

## Company Overview
BlackRock, Inc. (NYSE: BLK) is the world's largest asset manager, with $11.5 trillion in assets under management (AUM) as of September 30, 2024, spanning equities, fixed income, multi-asset, alternatives, and money market funds. Founded in 1988, the firm revolutionized investing through its iShares ETF franchise (launched 2000), which holds ~$3.5T AUM and dominates passive strategies. BlackRock's technology arm, Aladdin, provides risk analytics and portfolio management to 250+ clients managing $21.8T AUM. The company serves institutional investors (60% of revenue), retail via ETFs/mutual funds, and wealth advisors. Revenue streams include investment advisory/management fees (75%), administration/distribution fees (15%), and tech/services (10%). BlackRock emphasizes ETFs amid passive investing shift, alternatives growth (target 20% of AUM), and tech-driven efficiencies. It benefits from market beta (AUM tied to asset prices) and net inflows ($88B in Q3 2024). Challenges include fee compression and regulatory scrutiny on ESG/stewardship. With 20,600 employees, BlackRock operates globally (43% Americas, 30% EMEA, 27% APAC ex-Japan AUM), positioning it as a scale leader in a consolidating industry. (248 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q3 2024 Earnings (Reported Oct 11, 2024):** Record revenue of $3.83B (+11% YoY), EPS $10.30 (beat estimates), AUM $11.5T (+21% YoY). Net inflows $88B (strong ETF/alt), driven by equity markets and iShares Bitcoin ETF ($12B+ inflows YTD).
- **GIP Acquisition Close (Oct 1, 2024):** Completed $12.5B all-stock deal for Global Infrastructure Partners, adding $111B AUM, boosting infrastructure/alternatives platform to $370B.
- **Bitcoin ETF Milestone (Oct 2024):** iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) surpassed $20B AUM within 9 months of Jan 11, 2024 SEC approval; fastest ETF growth ever.
- **Personnel Moves (Sep 2024):** Hired State Street's Manish Mehta as Global Head of ETFs; Rachel Lord named EMEA CEO.
- **Regulatory:** SEC approved spot Ether ETF conversions (Jul 2024); BlackRock filed for tokenized funds (Mar 2024).
- **Online Buzz (Oct 2024):** CNBC/X discussions highlight BLK's ETF dominance amid Fed rate cuts; concerns over Trump admin potential ESG rollback.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Pillars:** Scale ETFs (target 50%+ revenue), expand alternatives to 20% AUM (from 16%), globalize via APAC/EMEA, monetize Aladdin (10% revenue growth target).
- **Digital Assets:** Launch more crypto ETPs post-IBIT success; BUIDL tokenized fund on Ethereum hit $240M (Sep 2024).
- **Private Markets:** Post-GIP, target $100B+ annual fundraising; infrastructure focus amid energy transition.
- **Tech Integration:** Aladdin enhancements with AI/ML for risk; partnerships for data (e.g., Preqin acquisition 2024).
- **Organic Inflows:** $491B long-term net inflows YTD through Q3 2024.

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category     | Tailwinds                                                                 | Headwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Record inflows ($88B Q3); ETF/crypto boom; GIP synergies ($50M cost saves 2025); market rally. | Fee pressure (basis points down 2bps YoY); high valuation (23x fwd P/E). |
| **Sector**  | Passive shift (ETFs 45% US equity AUM); rate cuts boost equities; alts demand ($20T opportunity). | Regulation (EU SFDR scrutiny); geopolitical risks; active mgmt outflows. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **ETFs (iShares):** 1,400+ products, $3.5T AUM; leaders in US equity (IVV), fixed income (TLT).
- **Index/Mutual Funds:** $4T AUM.
- **Alternatives:** $1.8T (PE, RE, infra, credit).
- **Aladdin:** SaaS platform, $1.5B revenue potential.
- **Cash Mgmt/SMA:** Wealth platforms (e.g., LifePath paychecks).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Tokenized Assets:** BUIDL fund (Mar 2024 launch, $240M AUM Sep 2024); plans for more on-chain funds (SEC filing Oct 2024).
- **Crypto ETFs:** Spot Ether ETF launch pending (post-Jul approval); RWA tokenization pilots.
- **AI-Driven Tools:** Aladdin AI upgrades (announced Q2 2024).
- **Infrastructure Funds:** GIP integration for $50B+ climate infra pipeline (2025).

## Market Share Approximations
| Segment              | BLK Share | Notes/Source (as of Q3 2024) |
|----------------------|-----------|------------------------------|
| Global AUM           | 8-10%    | $11.5T / $125T total (Bloomberg). |
| US ETFs              | 38%      | $3.1T / $8.1T (ETFGI Sep 2024). |
| Equity ETFs (Global) | 42%      | iShares lead (Morningstar Q3). |
| Alternatives         | 5-7%     | #1 in infra post-GIP (Preqin). |

**Forecast:** +1-2% global AUM share gain by 2026 via ETFs/alts; ETF share stable at 38-40% amid Vanguard competition; alts to 10% share with GIP.

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (Q2/Q3 2024) | BLK       | Vanguard (est.) | State Street | Fidelity  |
|---------------------|-----------|-----------------|--------------|-----------|
| AUM ($T)            | 11.5     | 9.3            | 4.4         | 5.5      |
| ETF AUM ($T)        | 3.5      | 2.8            | 1.2         | 0.8      |
| YTD Inflows ($B)    | 491      | 300+           | 50          | 100      |
| Revenue Growth YoY  | +11%     | +8% (est.)     | +5%         | +10%     |
| P/E (Fwd)           | 23x      | N/A (priv)     | 18x         | N/A      |

BLK leads scale/diversification; Vanguard cheaper fees; STT tech overlap.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** Microsoft (cloud/Aladdin, ongoing); Temasek/Singapore (APAC alts, 2024); Securitize (tokenization).
- **M&A:** GIP ($12.5B, closed Oct 1, 2024); Preqin (minority, Apr 2024); Aperio (custom indexing, prior).
- **Current Major Clients:** CalPERS/CalSTRS ($100B+ each); sovereigns (Saudi PIF $70B); BlackRock Inc. retirement plans.
- **Potential Clients:** Pension funds shifting to alts (e.g., Canadian plans); RIAs via SMA growth ($500B pipeline).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG/Stewardship:** $10T+ ESG AUM; voted 5M shares in 10K+ meetings (2024 proxy season); facing anti-ESG pushback (19 states sued, ongoing).
- **Risks:** Concentration (top 10 ETFs 40% revenue); beta to equities (AUM -15% in 2022 drawdown).
- **Strengths:** 90%+ recurring revenue; ROE 15%+; dividend aristocrat (yield 2.1%).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 8/10 (Strong Buy for growth upside; hold if risk-averse). BLK's ETF/crypto leadership, record inflows, and GIP bolt-on drive 10-12% EPS CAGR through 2026 amid bull markets. Risks moderated by diversification.
- **Fair Value Estimate:** $1,050 (8-10% upside from $976). Based on 24x 2025 EPS $43.50 (consensus), 2-stage DCF (8% growth taper), peers at 22x. Moderate risk: volatility from rates/AUM beta, but inflows resilient. Target 12-18 month horizon.
